conclusion: Analyze motion of particles A and B to determine ratio of magnitudes of acceleration during deceleration phases.
Particle A starts from rest, accelerates to 2v0 in time t0, then decelerates to rest in 2t0.
Particle B starts from rest, accelerates to v0 in time 2t0, then decelerates to rest in 3t0.
Determine acceleration phases for both particles.
Particle A deceleration: starts at t0, ends at 3t0, initial velocity 2v0, final velocity 0, time 2t0.
Particle B deceleration: starts at 2t0, ends at 5t0, initial velocity v0, final velocity 0, time 3t0.
Calculate ratio of magnitudes of accelerations: Ratio = (v0/t0) / (v0/3t0) = 3.
Final answer: The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their deceleration phases is 3.
